content:
That's a wonderful list of gratitude practices to incorporate into the workshop! I especially like the idea of the "Forgiveness Letter of Gratitude" and the "Gratitude Circle". I think these activities can help attendees shift their perspective and focus on the good in the situation. 

Speaking of perspectives, I've been thinking about how my recent experiences at St. Mary's Church on January 10th have influenced my thoughts on forgiveness and compassion. Father John's sermon really resonated with me, and I've been trying to incorporate more forgiveness and gratitude into my daily life. Do you think it would be helpful to share some personal anecdotes or experiences during the workshop to illustrate the power of forgiveness and gratitude?
